original_title: President Ranil calls for strong, united NAM to contribute to a better world
original_body_lines: President Ranil Wickremesinghe on Friday (Jan.18) highlighted how digital divide and Weapons of Mass Destruction have deepened inequalities between NAM (Non-Aligned Movement) developing states and the developed world.
Addressing the 19th Non-Aligned Movement Summit in Kampala, Uganda, Wickremesinghe also emphasized the need for a strong, united NAM, the President’s Media Division (PMD) said.
Furthermore, the Sri Lankan Head of the State urged the reinvention of NAM to contribute to a better world, according to the PMD.
Meanwhile, the President emphasized the importance of recognizing the West Bank, Gaza and East Jerusalem as part of the State of Palestine, aligning with UN Resolutions and the Summit’s Declaration.
